description.narrative: Communities, schools and health centers have increased and equitable access to safe water and improved sanitation and hygiene services

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, schools and health centers have increased and equitable access to safe water and improved sanitation and hygiene services

description.narrative: Access to WASH has increased. UNICEF continues to work closely with the Government to provide technical and financial support to strengthen the enabling environment and provide communities, schools, and health centres with safe water and improved sanitation and hygiene services. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/10/2018

# of additional people provided access to an improved drinking water source including those in humanitarian situations

Percentage of the population using basic sanitation services
National WASH policy and strategy is updated with strong focus on achieving universal access, equity and sustainability
Child-sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to WASH in emergencies are in place
Child-sensitive national risk management plan addressing risks related to WASH in emergencies in place
